utterances: HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Sitting there making all your naughty, nice decisions, office down the hall from Santa himself?
(As Spark) Well, it's not like right next to Santa, but...
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Well, you're up there.
You don't punch a clock, do you?
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Well, I'm proud of you.
(As Spark) I guess, but I remember getting Christmas presents every year.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Oh, well, you know, you were mostly good.
I mean, even if you didn't deserve them, I still love ya.
(As Spark) See, this is - I don't want to complain about this job.
But I'm sitting there all day, looking at like 30 seconds of video of a kid, and then they're breathing down my neck to make an instant decision, like, this kid's naughty; this kid's nice.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Somebody's got to make the call.
I really don't think this is how Santa would want it to run.
Well, you need to talk to Santa.
Oh, hey, Santa, just need an hour of your time.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) No, no, no. You know, once he came to the toy factory, talked to every single worker.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) That's not how he wants things where you can't say anything.
He's a very jolly man, but he's very reasonable.
(As Spark) Dad, he has layers of managers.
I've literally never run into him in the elevator.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) Talk to Santa.
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) And when you talk to him...
HERBSTMAN: (As Spark's dad) ...You got to remember everything, and then I want you to tell me everything that he said.
I put in for a meeting with Santa today.
So what we're going to do is I'm going to alert your department as soon as there's an opening to meet with Santa.
(As Spark) I really need to meet with him today.
(As Santa's secretary) I'm sure that Santa is dying to meet with you as well...
(As Santa's secretary) ...He's just superduper busy with all the children's wish lists.
(As Spark) What if I just sit down on the couch, and as soon as he pops out, that's - oh.
(As coal lobbyist) Remember the magic number is 2000 tons.
(As Santa) And have a Merry Christmas.
(As coal lobbyist) If this works out we'll all have a Merry Christmas.
(As Santa's secretary) He happens to be the most influential lobbyist for the coal industry and a very, very good friend of Santa's.
